text: Aug 12 New Jerseys highest court on Wednesday rejected an effort by state Republicans to block Democratic Governor Phil Murphy from borrowing as much as $9.9 billion to help offset plunging tax revenue resulting from the coronavirus pandemic.The New Jersey Supreme Court said the states COVID-19 Emergency Bond Act was constitutional.It also said state officials will need to certify that projected revenue shortfalls were a result of the pandemic before they can borrow, meaning that the ultimate amount borrowed may be less than $9.9 billion. (Reporting by Jonathan Stempel in New York Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
